comments.body: Cool idea!

Would the totem be like a Totem of Hearing allowing the player to see sounds through blocks making easier to locate mobs or players 

Edit: Thanks guys and I like all your ideas
I like that idea for what it could do and maybe it could be called the soundray totem? I am not that good with names either.
totem of sensitivity. it makes the screen blurry wherever a nearby mob is
what about totem of the listener, and when you hold it your vision goes all black, and when something makes sound you can see coloured ripples from the source of the noise?

Your idea is really creative, but I don't think it'd fit into Minecraft. It'd give an incentive to try and kill the warden, which the developers don't want. However, I like the idea, and it'd make a create mod once the warden is introduced!
It would be a good idea if you need the totem only once so you have to kill only one warden.

Maybe not a a totem specifically for hearing. But maybe the Warden could drop its antlers, and then you could attatch it to a helmet. When wearing this helmet any vibrations created by mobs or other things within a certain radius will give a glowing effect around them, but only for the time they make the vibrations. You would not be able to detect any through wool blocks. Additionally players sneaking would not be detected either.
it should be like a totem of undying but with more uses so people will want to use it
It would be the "Sculck Totem". When a noise is heard (footsteps, mob sounds, etc.), It shows kind of like glowing from Java.
when I saw this my first thought was shooting stalactites/stalagmites with crossbows.
Yeah that's a cool idea that make sense shooting fragiles cause them to break.
I think that skeletons should shoot them down

These are just my ideas, I think yours are probably better.

100% agreed. Also the toughness of deepslate makes this even worse. Also, now with ore gen few diamonds generate in the caves (one ore if you're lucky), and on top of that mining the old way completely sucks because of deepslate. Ngl I completely dislike the whole game mechanics so far. Sure it's pretty, but it isn't playable as Minecraft, the game we know.

I wholeheartedly disagree with the top comment. Diamonds are not that rare at all. Without the decreased air exposure (Bedrock 1.17.30), I once found 23 Diamonds in around an hour of cave exploration. Assuming 50% or even 25% of those Diamonds, I would have found at least 6 Diamonds within my exploration; didn't even take that long. That's besides the fact that the new caves are very immersive and much more enjoyable to explore (same applies for surface gen), at least from my experience, and I'm sure most people agree given the overall feedback I've read.
maybe... or a ice castle.
It could have minor buffs, as in small saturation.

Milk bowl? :/

Cheese would be good, they could add more foods (and there are no tomatoes in Minecraft, so how would they make Pizza anyway?).
Would be nice if you could give milk to cats, but not necessary.
tbh I think the cool generation and ores are enough incentive for players to go to the moutains.

Nice Idea,I think the dragon fight has no useful rewards (If you consider the Dragon egg an actual reward). One of this rewards could be some sort of key that opens places in your world that you couldn't before, like ruins. Also, a cool way of improve the actual dragon fight could be placing each ender pillar on its own little island. A plummet attack would also be cool, imagine if in the main island there are like some sort of little bone structures or rocks that could be thrown at you when performing this attack.

I love the idea. I think the best way to make the boss fight better is by making the dragon do more than fly in circles and hover over the portal back to the overworld. It should land at times and claw and bite the player. It would also be cool if they made it so the pillars in the End were part of a ruined castle or something. The dragon could on occasion chase you through the walls. Also I think they should remove the feature that makes the dragon fly threw blocks, its weird and doesn't make any sense.

They shouldn't change what the dragon is, or even how it looks, however, they can make the boss fight better without doing that. Jess (if I remember correctly, that is the name of the Ender Dragon if you didn't know) has legs, but she doesn't use them...

I would like to see Jess land and fight you on the surface of the end, and maybe even uses attacks that are unique to when she has all the ender crystals (ie. a beam attack, like the beam the crystals shoot to help her regenerate) or an attack where she shoots an ender crystal-like thing that explodes on impact. I also think maybe she could have an "invulnerability state" like the wither.

These kinds of things would make the fight more dangerous and add more variation to the fight. Perhaps they could be unlocked when you revive the dragon for a more challenging second fight. I never really liked the fact that the wither was more dangerous than the final boss, or that you can't even reach the final boss for the majority of the fight...

I don't really agree I really like the ender dragons current texture it really fits in with the undermans texture, but some new attacks would be great, and the idea of it turning into a demon isn't something I would really like to see, but maybe it could turn into some sort of giant enderman like maybe it could fly and summon miniature ender dragons
